But O'Conner's judgement becomes clouded when he falls in love with Toretto's sister, Mia.

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Paul Walker. Disgraced cop Brian O'Conner is given the chance to redeem himself by going under cover to entrap a powerful Miami drugs baron.

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
programme.desc: Action thriller sequel starring Lucas Black. To avoid jail for illegal street racing, a bad-boy teenager is sent to Japan to stay with his estranged father. However, his discovery of drifting, a new style of racing reliant on the use of oversteering, soon gets him into more trouble.

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: Action thriller in which Vin Diesel and Paul Walker, the stars of the first film in the street-racing franchise, team up again. Criminal Dominic Toretto returns to LA to avenge the murder of one of his friends by a drug kingpin, bringing him face to face with an old rival - FBI agent Brian O'Conner.

programme.title: Kraven the Hunter
programme.desc: Conservationist Sergei Kravinoff's complex relationship with his ruthless father, Nikolai, sets him on a path of vengeance with brutal consequences, motivating him to become Kraven, the world's most feared hunter. Fantasy adventure, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Russell Crowe and Ariana Debose.

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: Crime thriller based on the hit US TV series, starring Denzel Washington. On the face of it, Robert McCall is just an ordinary guy who works at a DIY store and leads a quiet life. But when McCall befriends a young girl controlled by ruthless Russian gangsters, he's unable to stand idly by and resorts to using skills from his shady former career.

programme.title: The Equalizer 2
programme.desc: Crime thriller starring Denzel Washington and Pedro Pascal. Now living a peaceful life, former Marine and government agent Robert McCall offers his singular skills pro bono to those in need. However, when his friend is killed under suspicious circumstances, McCall investigates, and uses any means necessary to see justice served.

programme.title: The Beekeeper
programme.desc: An apparently unassuming man finds someone very important to him has been scammed and driven to harm. Revealed as a former operative of a powerful and clandestine organisation known as 'Beekeepers', he sets out on a brutal quest of vengeance, hunting those responsible for the incident, who have seriously underestimated how much of a threat he is. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Jeremy Iro

programme.desc: Aquaman must retrieve the legendary Trident of Atlan to save the underwater city of Atlantis -- and the surface world -- from his power-hungry brother.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Black Manta wields the power of the mythic Black Trident to unleash an ancient and malevolent force. Hoping to end his reign of terror, Aquaman forges an unlikely alliance with his brother to protect their kingdom and save the world from destruction.

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: After leaving her all-female island for the first time, Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) discovers her full powers and true destiny while fighting alongside men in a war to end all wars.

programme.title: Wonder Woman 1984
programme.desc: Wonder Woman musters all of her strength, wisdom and courage as she finds herself squaring off against Maxwell Lord and the Cheetah, a villainess who possesses superhuman strength and agility.

programme.title: Super/Man: The Christopher Reeve Story
programme.desc: Actor Christopher Reeve rises to stardom when he lands the role of Superman in the 1970s. When a horse-riding accident leaves him paralyzed in 1995, Reeve spends the rest of his life searching for a cure for spinal cord injuries.

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: While Lex Luthor plots against him, the Man of Steel tries to reconnect with Lois Lane and find his place in a world that learned to survive in his absence.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent (Henry Cavill) must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: Jor-El (Marlon Brando) of Krypton sends his baby to Earth, where he grows up as Clark Kent (Christopher Reeve) and works at the Daily Planet.

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel (Christopher Reeve) gets serious with Lois Lane (Margot Kidder) and fights three Krypton outcasts in league with Lex Luthor (Gene Hackman).

programme.title: Superman III
programme.desc: Ersatz kryptonite laced with tobacco tar splits Superman (Christopher Reeve) in two: good Clark Kent and bad Man of Steel.

programme.title: Funny People
programme.desc: A gravely ill comic (Adam Sandler) takes a struggling performer (Seth Rogen) under his wing, then gets a chance to re-evaluate his life when his disease goes into remission.

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: After a wild stag party in Las Vegas, three hazy groomsmen (Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis) must find their missing friend and get him back to Los Angeles in time for his wedding.

programme.title: Jerry Garcia: It's Not My Weekend
programme.desc: Rising comedian and single father Jerry Garcia makes fun of himself, his parenting style, and his dating life.

programme.title: Chris Rock: Kill the Messenger
programme.desc: The comic performs at South Africa's Carnival City Casino, the Apollo Theatre in New York and the Carling Apollo Hammersmith in London.

programme.title: James Acaster: Hecklers Welcome
programme.desc: James Acaster gives up control of his set and embraces audience participation as he explores his complex relationship with stand-up.

programme.title: David Brenner: Back With a Vengeance
programme.desc: The comedian skewers current events and societal follies at a performance in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: The nominating fight between Selina and her rivals reaches its climax, as their race comes to a historic finish.

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: Deadshot (Will Smith), Harley Quinn (Margot Robbie), Captain Boomerang, Killer Croc and other armed supervillains unite to battle a mysterious and powerful entity, while the diabolical Joker (Jared Leto) launches an evil agenda of his own.

programme.title: The Nut Job
programme.desc: A mischievous squirrel and his sidekick assemble a ragtag animal crew to get inside their town's nut shop and steal enough food for the winter.

programme.title: Rio
programme.desc: A domesticated macaw (Jesse Eisenberg) and his human friend (Leslie Mann) travel to Rio de Janeiro to meet the last surviving female (Anne Hathaway) of his kind.

programme.title: The Princess Bride
programme.desc: A storybook stableboy turns pirate (Cary Elwes) and rescues his beloved (Robin Wright), who is about to marry a dreadful prince.

programme.title: Seth Meyers: Dad Man Walking
programme.desc: Emmy-winning writer, New York Times bestselling author and SNL alum Seth Meyers stars in his first HBO stand-up special.

programme.title: Nikki Glaser: Someday You'll Die
programme.desc: Nikki Glaser dives into a wide range of topics including why she doesn't want kids, the harsh realities of aging, her sexual fantasies, and plans for her own death all in her hilarious, unapologetic, and brutally honest style.

programme.title: Nikki Glaser: Good Clean Filth
programme.desc: Nikki Glaser takes on a range of topics in her brutally honest yet conversational style, including dishing about sex, outlining the do's and don'ts of dating, how to trick someone into marriage and oversharing about her not-so-private parts.

programme.title: Whitney Cummings: I'm Your Girlfriend
programme.desc: The actress/comic provides brutally honest observations in a performance at the Broad Stage in Santa Monica, Calif.

programme.title: Yvonne Orji: A Whole Me
programme.desc: Orji uses therapy as a through line to discuss her thoughts on friendship, dating, adulting and why guys need better friends; Orji shows her range while also being a no-holds-barred therapy session for all.

programme.title: Live: Amy Schumer: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: The comic brings her unique blend of honesty and unapologetic sense of humor to a performance at the historic Apollo Theater in New York.

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: President Skroob (Mel Brooks) pits evil Dark Helmet (Rick Moranis) against Lone Starr and the half-man, half-dog Barf (John Candy).

programme.title: Love & Other Drugs
programme.desc: A pharmaceutical salesman (Jake Gyllenhaal) begins a tempestuous romance with a free-spirited Parkinson's patient (Anne Hathaway).

programme.title: Shazam!
programme.desc: Billy Batson is a streetwise 14-year-old who can magically transform into the adult superhero Shazam simply by shouting out one word. His newfound powers soon get put to the test when he squares off against the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana.

programme.title: Snatched
programme.desc: Dumped by her boyfriend, Emily persuades her mother, Linda, to accompany her on an exotic getaway to South America. The two polar opposites must quickly work through their differences to escape from a wildly outrageous and dangerous jungle adventure.

programme.title: The Big Year
programme.desc: Three men (Steve Martin, Jack Black, Owen Wilson) race around North America in a prestigious contest to see who can spot the greatest number of bird species in a single year.

programme.title: Pee-wee as Himself
programme.desc: In the 1980s, Paul Reubens becomes a global sensation with his alter-ego Pee-wee Herman, but fame proves to be a complicated companion.

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Five competitors provide an inside look at the world of professional cycling and its checkered history with doping.

programme.title: Clear History
programme.desc: A man (Larry David) hatches a plot for revenge when his former boss (Jon Hamm) visits the island that he calls home.

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: A widower (Matt Damon) relocates his family to a dilapidated zoo and, with the help of its eclectic staff, works to restore the facility to its former glory.

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: A lethal CIA agent (Dwayne Johnson) and his former classmate (Kevin Hart) encounter shootouts, espionage and double-crosses while trying to save the U.S. spy satellite system.

programme.title: Land of the Lost
programme.desc: A time-space vortex sucks a scientific has-been (Will Ferrell) and his companions (Anna Friel, Danny R. McBride) into an alternate dimension populated by dinosaurs and painfully slow creatures called Sleestaks.

programme.title: Cop Out
programme.desc: Two veteran NYPD detectives (Bruce Willis, Tracy Morgan) confront a gangster who is obsessed with sports memorabilia in order to retrieve an invaluable baseball card.

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: Love at the Store
programme.desc: The comic discusses topics including poverty, wealth, crime and race in a performance at the Comedy Store in Hollywood, Calif.

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: 8
programme.desc: The comic discusses Donald Trump's presidential victory, climate change, animal rights and other topics in his second solo special taped in the round at the Masonic Hall in New York.

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: Rothaniel
programme.desc: Jerrod Carmichael performs before a live audience at the legendary Blue Note Jazz Club in New York City.

programme.desc: Porky Pig and Daffy Duck become Earth's only hope when their antics at the local bubble-gum factory uncover a secret alien mind-control plot. Faced with cosmic odds, they must save their town and the world while not driving each other totally looney.

programme.title: Woman at War
programme.desc: Halla is a 50-year-old environmental activist who crusades against the local aluminum industry in Iceland. As her actions grow bolder, her life changes in the blink of an eye when she's finally granted permission to adopt a girl from the Ukraine.

programme.title: Support the Girls
programme.desc: Lisa is the general manager of Double Whammies, a sports bar that features skimpily dressed waitresses. Always nurturing and protective of her staff, she soon faces one trying day that tests her optimism at every turn.

programme.desc: Two turkeys (Owen Wilson, Woody Harrelson) travel back in time to the year 1621 to prevent all feathered friends from ever becoming holiday dinners.

programme.desc: After his girlfriend dumps him for a skier, a teen (John Cusack) meets an exchange student (Diane Franklin) from France.

programme.desc: When a technical genius kidnaps retired spies (Antonio Banderas, Carla Gugino), only their children can save them.

programme.desc: Chaos reigns when a cartoonist's (Jamie Kennedy) son is born with extraordinary powers and the god Loki (Alan Cumming) returns to retrieve his mask.

programme.desc: Three high-school friends make a discovery that gives them incredible superpowers, but their lives spin out of control when their darker sides begin to emerge.

programme.desc: Madea (Tyler Perry) gets herself into outrageous situations while helping children save their youth center.

programme.desc: A boy tries to rescue his sister (Alexa Vega) inside a virtual-reality game created by a madman out to enslave children.

programme.title: The LEGO Batman Movie

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa
programme.desc: Zoo animals (Ben Stiller, Chris Rock) from New York meet others of their species for the first time after crash-landing on the Dark Continent.

programme.desc: A 12-year-old becomes an environmental activist; the impact of warming temperatures and pollution on fish; the impact of climate change on species like the mosquito and the giant crab; readings by Tina Fey, Jeffrey Wright and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: Opus
programme.desc: A journalist is invited to the remote compound of a legendary pop star who mysteriously disappeared 30 years ago. Surrounded by the star's cult of sycophants, she gets caught in the middle of his twisted plan.

programme.title: Pride & Prejudice
programme.desc: A convoluted courtship begins between a young woman (Keira Knightley) and the handsome friend (Matthew Macfadyen) of a wealthy bachelor.

programme.title: The Bank Job
programme.desc: In 1971 London, a car dealer (Jason Statham) and his gang of thieves break into a bank vault and find far more than cash and jewelry.

programme.title: The Last Days on Mars
programme.desc: Astronauts (Liev Schreiber, Elias Koteas, Romola Garai) on Mars contend with a microbe that turns those it infects into zombielike killers.

programme.title: Heretic
programme.desc: A diabolical Mr. Reed ensnares two young missionaries in a terrifying game of cat and mouse when they knock on the wrong door and are forced to prove their faith.

programme.title: Unknown
programme.desc: After a serious car accident, a man (Liam Neeson) awakes to find that his wife does not recognize him, that another man has assumed his identity, and that assassins are hunting him.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: Tormented by her peers and sheltered by her religious mother (Julianne Moore), an awkward teenager (ChloÃ« Grace Moretz) unleashes her hidden, telekinetic powers after a sick prank at her senior prom pushes her over the edge.

programme.title: Music Box
programme.desc: A collection of documentary films exploring pivotal moments in the music world.

programme.title: Toni Morrison: The Pieces I Am
programme.desc: Author Toni Morrison leads an assembly of her peers, critics and colleagues on an exploration of race, history, America and the human condition.

programme.title: Cunningham
programme.desc: The artistic evolution of Merce Cunningham -- from his early years as a struggling dancer in postwar New York to his emergence as one of the world's most visionary choreographers.

programme.title: Big Star: Nothing Can Hurt Me
programme.desc: In the 1970s, Memphis-based band Big Star achieved critical acclaim but not mainstream success. Despite a lack of popularity, the band's music influenced such diverse artists as R.E.M., Wilco, Jeff Buckley and Elliot Smith.

programme.title: Gimme Shelter
programme.desc: Filmmakers Albert Maysles, David Maysles and Charlotte Zwerin show the Rolling Stones' 1969 California concert.

programme.desc: Members of the Justice League are transported to the world of Remnant and find themselves turned into teenagers. The Remnant heroes combine forces with the Justice League to uncover why their planet has been mysteriously altered.

programme.desc: The Justice League emerge in their own world to discover that Grimm have overtaken Earth.

programme.title: Reframed: Next Gen Narratives
programme.desc: In this series, six filmmakers adapt classic movies through a contemporary lens, tackling modern-day issues surrounding identity.

programme.title: Megan Leavey
programme.desc: Young Marine Cpl. Megan Leavey starts to identify with Rex, a particularly aggressive combat dog that she trains. Together, they complete more than 100 missions until an improvised explosive device injures both, putting their fates in jeopardy.

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga: Chapter 1
programme.desc: In 1859 families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas. Meanwhile, a gruff cowboy soon finds himself on the run with a prostitute and a young boy after killing a fellow gunman.

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder and determined to save others from the same fate, Dr. Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. While at first it seems to be a radical success, a darkness inside of him is soon unleashed.

programme.title: Another Earth
programme.desc: Following her release from prison, a morose young woman (Brit Marling) seeks out the man (William Mapother) whose life she shattered in a car accident several years earlier.

programme.title: Trees, and Other Entanglements
programme.desc: People and the natural world intertwine in the stories of a young boy hidden among trees, an artist refining American bonsai, a photographer observing trees, a mother fighting to protect the forests and a man who steadfastly plants them.

programme.title: Kusama: Infinity
programme.desc: Artist Yayoi Kusama's journey from a conservative upbringing in Japan to her brush with fame in America during the 1960s.

programme.title: A Revolution on Canvas
programme.desc: Sara Nodjoumi investigates the disappearance of more than 100 "treasonous" paintings by her father, Iranian artist Nickzad Nodjoumi.

programme.title: I Love You Forever
programme.desc: Following a young woman into and out of an emotionally abusive relationship.

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Teens meet with horrible ends after a classmate's (Devon Sawa) precognitive vision leads to their ejection from a doomed airliner.

programme.title: Final Destination 2
programme.desc: Death returns to claim the lives of those who did not die in a horrible highway calamity as they were meant to do.

programme.title: Final Destination 3
programme.desc: A high-school senior (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) and her friends must deal with repercussions of cheating death when they survive a terrible roller-coaster accident.
